content:
It looks like x.py doc is broken right now, probably due to stage 0 default; would be good to fix that if possible

Documenting standalone (x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu)
error: unknown debugging option: `normalize_docs`

command did not execute successfully: "/home/mark/Build/rust/build/bootstrap/debug/rustdoc" "-Znormalize_docs" "-Winvalid_codeblock_attributes" "-Z" "unstable-options" "--html-after-content" "/home/mark/Build/rust/src/doc/footer.inc" "--html-before-content" "/home/mark/Build/rust/build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/doc/version_info.html" "--html-in-header" "/home/mark/Build/rust/src/doc/favicon.inc" "--markdown-no-toc" "--index-page" "/home/mark/Build/rust/src/doc/index.md" "--markdown-playground-url" "https://play.rust-lang.org/" "-o" "/home/mark/Build/rust/build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/doc" "/home/mark/Build/rust/src/doc/tutorial.md" "--markdown-css" "rust.css"
I think that just needs a if stage != 0 in rustbuild
